titleStmt.title: Poems By Thomas Carevv Esquire. One of the gentlemen of the Privie-Chamber, and Sewer in Ordinary to His Majesty.
titleStmt.author: Carew, Thomas, 1595?-1639?
Carew, Thomas, 1595?-1639? Cœlum Britannicum.
Jones, Inigo, 1573-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I.D. for Thomas Walkley, and are to be sold at the signe of the flying Horse, between Brittains Burse, and York-House,

notesStmt.note: Printed by John Dawson. Cf. STC.
"Cœlum Brittanicum" has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
The designer for the masque was Inigo Jones, whose name appears on the internal title page for "Cœlum Britannicum".

The imprint for "Cœlum Brittanicum" reads "London. Printed by Thomas Walkley. 1640." Variant: imprint reads "Printed by I.D. for Thomas Walkley, and are to be sold at his shop near White-Hall. 1640.".
Cœlum Britannicum also issued separately as STC 4618.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: the signe of the flying Horse, between Brittains Burse
